definition: to walk (side part of split character)
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
to be late/to arrive slowly/to be slow in the coming

sentences.english: The sun rises late and set early.
We can do it later when we have more money.
sentences.chinese: 等我們有足夠的資金再做也不遲。

sentences.english: She him all the better for his fluent spoken English.
sentences.chinese: 正因爲他遲踊口流利的英語，她更愛他。

sentences.english: I'm sorry. I was a little late.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，稍微來遲了一會兒。

sentences.english: At his instigation , the water carriers deliberately delayed their delivery by two days.
sentences.chinese: 在他的鼓動下，他們故意比規定的日期遲了兩天獻水。

sentences.english: New Year's Eve is the time for family reunion.
sentences.chinese: 除夕之夜，遲一頓豐富年夜飯，是家人團聚的時候。

sentences.english: Caliban's exact nature continues to be slightly ambiguous later.
sentences.chinese: 醜陋的精確自然繼續些微曖昧比較遲的。

sentences.english: Sooner or later we have to put aside our denial and face the world.
sentences.chinese: 或遲或早我們終歸要拋開否認而直面這個現實的世界。

sentences.english: "You will die of grief sooner or later, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “或遲或早，你會死於悲傷，”他說。

sentences.english: Wer reitet so sp(a:)t durch Nacht und Wind?
sentences.chinese: 這樣遲誰在黑夜和風中奔馳？

sentences.english: Although the monk chased after it, it was still too late.
sentences.chinese: 雖然和尚立刻追了過去，不過還是遲了一步。

sentences.english: I'll wait for you at the school gate whether you come early or late.
sentences.chinese: 無論你來得早還是遲我都會在校門口等你。

sentences.english: It is better late than never.
sentences.chinese: 但遲做總比不做來得好。

sentences.english: If a girl looks swell when she meets you, who gives a damn if she’s late?
sentences.chinese: 如果一個漂亮女孩來見你，誰他媽關心她遲沒遲到？

sentences.english: With development crashing through the hutong, this is a restaurant to visit sooner rather than later.
sentences.chinese: 隨着衚衕的日益消逝，拜訪這家店宜早不宜遲。

sentences.english: Woltz kept him waiting for a half hour past the appointed time.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾茲使他等到遲了半個小時才和他見面。

definition: to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
